title: QA Mapping Spine: Field Structure Theory (FST) / Structural Physics (SP) — Plenum-to-Particle Loop Sequence

source_artifacts.title: QA-native mapping of FST Plenum-to-Particle Loop Sequence

pattern_space.name: Plenum configuration space Ω
pattern_space.description: Non-local, isometric loop potential from which space/time and matter emerge via condensation and interaction. QA translation: pre-geometry layer — a state space of admissible discrete configurations where space/time are derived observables.
primary_claim_refs: Paper Summary: Plenum consists of continuous action loops
Cover Letter: action condenses from non-local background isometric looped Plenum

fields.name: loop_count_total_loves
fields.semantics: Total loop quanta (Loves) in structure; mass proxy.

fields.name: sector
fields.semantics: Chiral sector / observer-relative visibility. Rspin = anti-matter (deployed, rotating), Aspin = real-matter (may condense).

fields.name: deployment
fields.semantics: Whether loopage is deployed vs condensed into interaction boundary.

fields.name: cloak_state
fields.semantics: Which sector is cloaked by the other (observability obstruction). Cloaking occurs when condensed Aspin fully encloses deployed Rspin.

fields.name: stf_basis_decomposition
fields.semantics: Representation in STF basis {3, 9, 27, 81, 243, 729, 2187} and/or combinations.

generators.name: sigma
generators.semantics: Add one loop quantum (Loves). Adding more loopage increases the energy.

generators.name: lambda_3
generators.semantics: STF iteration scale step. Hierarchy uses 3^n: {3, 9, 27, 81, 243, 729, 2187}.

generators.name: mu
generators.semantics: Rspin <-> Aspin involution / chirality swap. Same structure, opposite handedness.

generators.name: kappa
generators.semantics: Boundary formation / condensation operator. Deployed loopage can condense to nucleus.

generators.name: chi
generators.semantics: Cloaking operator controlling observability by boundary intersection. Produces CLOAKED_FROM_OBSERVER obstruction depending on observer sector.

invariants.name: delta_sym
invariants.description: Normalized symmetry defect relative to Plenum template (superimposability). Stable particles have delta_sym <= threshold.

invariants.name: obs_projector
invariants.description: Observer-relative visibility given sector and cloak state.

obstruction_types.rule: If decomposition in STF basis is absent or invalid for claimed particle class.
If delta_sym exceeds threshold for stability claim.
If cloak_state blocks boundary intersection for observer sector.
If arithmetic or figures inside the source text are self-inconsistent; record invariant_diff and continue with warning.

determinism.canonical_json: UTF-8, keys sorted, separators=(',',':'), no NaN/Infinity, numbers as JSON numbers.

steps.action: Load spine + certificate JSON; verify schema_version matches expected.
Compute canonical_json and sha256; compare with sha256_manifest.
Validate STF basis coefficients and recompute l_total from basis; compare.
Compute delta_sym from symmetry_witness using declared metric; threshold-check for stability claims.
For each ratio/decay test: recompute ratios and residuals; classify SOURCE_NUMERIC_DRIFT if internal inconsistencies exceed tolerance.
Emit {move, fail_type, invariant_diff} records for any violated check.
Return pass/fail plus metrics bundle (residuals, delta_sym, ratio deltas).

external_reference_sources.label: PDG
external_reference_sources.note: Particle Data Group proton mass. Used as independent reference for SOURCE_NUMERIC_DRIFT classification.

cover_letter_claims: Manuscript is 12 pages; introduces SP/FST; maps STF loop counts to particle mass ratios in eV; claims quantitative consistency.
Original and not under consideration elsewhere.
